subtitle: A tasty alternative to traditional Chelsea buns, the apricot and pistachio filling is equally delicious.

method.text: Put the flour and seasoning into a mixing bowl. Sprinkle in the yeast. Rub half the butter into the flour along with 25 g of the sugar.
Beat the egg into the milk. Make a well in the centre of the flour and pour in the milk. Knead the dough until smooth, but not sticky, for about 5-10 min. Place back into a clean bowl.
Leave to prove in a warm place covered with cling film until doubled in size.
Make up the filling by mixing all the ingredients together.
Knock back the risen dough and re-knead for 5 min. Roll out on a lightly floured surface to a rectangle 23 x 30 cm.
Dot the remaining butter and sugar over the dough and sprinkle on the filling. Roll up like a Swiss roll.
Cut the dough into 9 even-sized pieces. Place them into a greased and lined 18 - 20 cm square tin. Leave to rise in a bowl covered with cling film for 30 min.
Bake for about 30-35 min, or until well risen and golden brown.
To make the sugar glaze, dissolve the caster sugar in the water then boil until thick and syrupy (but do not allow to colour). Brush carefully onto the buns then sprinkle on the Demerara sugar.

title: Apricot Chelsea buns
